description:
An active cloud account takeover campaign has impacted dozens of Azure environments and compromised hundreds of user accounts.

The post Ongoing Azure Cloud Account Takeover Campaign Targeting Senior Personnel appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Ongoing Azure Cloud Account Takeover Campaign Targeting Senior Personnel

description:
ExpressVPN disables split tunneling on Windows after learning that DNS requests were not properly directed.

The post ExpressVPN User Data Exposed Due to Bug appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: ExpressVPN User Data Exposed Due to Bug

description:
A possibly China-linked threat actor uses a custom backdoor in a cyberespionage campaign ongoing since at least 2021.

The post Stealthy Cyberespionage Campaign Remained Undiscovered for Two Years appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Stealthy Cyberespionage Campaign Remained Undiscovered for Two Years

description:
Bugcrowd has raised $102 million in strategic growth funding, which it will use to accelerate growth and improve its platform.

The post Bugcrowd Raises $102 Million  appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Bugcrowd Raises $102 Million

description:
Organizations urged to hunt for potential compromise as exploitation of a recent Ivanti enterprise VPN vulnerability begins.

The post Exploitation of Another Ivanti VPN Vulnerability Observed appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Exploitation of Another Ivanti VPN Vulnerability Observed

description:
Warzone RAT dismantled in international law enforcement operation that also involved arrests of suspects in Malta and Nigeria.

The post Warzone RAT Shut Down by Law Enforcement, Two Arrested appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Warzone RAT Shut Down by Law Enforcement, Two Arrested
